channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What We Know About the Mass Shooting in Sweden
item.description: The authorities said that at least 11 people were killed and that the suspect was believed to be among the dead.

item.title: Elon Musk says he will be irreparably harmed if OpenAI isn’t stopped. The federal judge overseeing his lawsuit called it a ‘stretch’
item.description: At the heart of the dispute is a 2017 internal power struggle at the fledgling startup that led to Altman becoming OpenAI’s CEO.

item.title: Patients will pay more for prescription meds and face drug shortages amid Trump tariffs, pharma groups warn
item.description: China, one of the countries affected by the new tariffs, is the world’s largest producer of active pharmaceutical ingredients.

item.title: A Veteran U.K. Political Battler Takes on Trump’s Washington
item.description: Peter Mandelson, Britain’s new ambassador to the United States, will try to sustain a relationship strained by President Trump’s disdain for alliances...

item.title: Buffalo Bills Fans Have It Tough, Especially in Antarctica
item.description: Research scientists in remote locations need to get creative in order to follow their favorite teams, even when they don’t like the outcomes.

item.title: Amid a global loss of trust, institutions must prove their value, says Edelman’s CEO
item.description: What institutions do Americans trust the most? Businesses, according to the latest Edelman Trust Barometer.

item.title: What We Know About the Mass Shooting in Sweden
item.description: The authorities said that at least 11 people were killed and that the suspect was believed to be among the dead.

item.title: Farewell, quiet quitting. 2025 could be the year of ‘revenge quitting’
item.description: Worker dissatisfaction could lead to a revolt.

item.title: As Elon Musk Dismantles USAID, Foreign Leaders Rejoice
item.description: Leaders in Russia, Hungary and El Salvador welcomed the Trump administration’s assault on U.S.A.I.D., which many authoritarians have seen as a threat.

item.title: Trump Brazenly Defies Laws in Escalating Executive Power Grab
item.description: In the radical opening weeks of his second term, President Trump has appeared to feel little constraint by any need to show respect for the rule of la...

item.title: U.S. Trade Deficit Hit Record in 2024 as Imports Surged
item.description: A strong dollar helped drive an uptick in U.S. imports last year, while export growth remained modest.

item.title: Novo Nordisk missed its diversity targets last year, and its CEO paid a financial price
item.description: Novo Nordisk's CEO took a $1.5 million pay cut in 2024 as the pharma giant's share price tanked and it missed profit and DEI targets.

item.title: Manhunt in Brussels After Masked Men Open Fire Outside Metro Station
item.description: The authorities said no injuries had been reported, but two metro stations were closed on Wednesday after the shooting.

item.title: The Search for the Original Silly Goose in the Fossil Record
item.description: Some paleontologists think that fossils recovered from Antarctica are evidence of birds similar to modern geese and ducks that lived alongside the din...

item.title: Police Searching for Gunman After Shooting in Central Ohio Kills 1
item.description: Five others were injured in New Albany, and the police were working to apprehend the shooter, who they said did not pose a threat to the public.
